{{Short description|American comic book fictional character}} {{Multiple issues| {{no sources|date=August 2018}} {{Notability|date=August 2018}} {{In-universe|date=August 2018}} }} {{Infobox comics character |image= Freakshow-by-Aaron-Lopresti.jpg |caption=Freakshow
Art by [[Aaron Lopresti]] |character_name=Freakshow |real_name= |species=[[Mutant (Marvel Comics)|Human Mutant]] |publisher=[[Marvel Comics]] |debut=''Excalibur'' vol. 3 #1 (2004) |creators=[[Chris Claremont]] |alliances=[[Excalibur (comics)|Genoshan Excalibur]] |aliases= |powers=Ability to transform into a variety of monstrous forms with unique abilities }} '''Freakshow''' is a [[fictional character]] appearing in [[American comic book]]s published by [[Marvel Comics]]. The character was created by [[Chris Claremont]] for the third installment of the series ''Excalibur''. He is one of the few survivors of the island of [[Genosha]] which was destroyed by the wild [[Sentinel (comics)|Sentinel]] attacks commissioned by [[Cassandra Nova]]. ==Fictional character biography== Very little is known about Freakshow, except that he is one of the few survivors of the island of Genosha after the Sentinel attacks on the capital of '''Hammer Bay'''. Somehow he finds himself to be the traveling companion of [[Wicked (comics)|Wicked]] and becomes an unofficial pupil of [[Professor X]]. He soon proved his usefulness in dispatching a [[skirmish]] between the Professor and the local bully [[Unus the Untouchable]]. Knowing that he couldn't do anything to harm Unus, Xavier had Freakshow swallow the man whole. Because of Unus' natural [[force field (science fiction)|force field]] he was unharmed, albeit shaken when Freakshow vomited him up later.{{issue|date=January 2011}} He helps his friend Wicked survive an attack by Magistrates, military forces who were once the murderous law-enforcement arm of the Genoshan government.{{issue|date=January 2011}} During their efforts to rebuild Genosha, Freakshow takes on a [[worm]]-like form and digests the [[debris]] of many shattered buildings to turn it into [[arable land]].{{issue|date=January 2011}} After the events of the [[House of M]], Freakshow is revealed to be one of the many mutants to lose his abilities as a result of the Scarlet Witch's decimation. He has been seen with a number of Genoshan mutants, including [[Unus the Untouchable]] and [[Wicked (comics)|Wicked]]. In ''Son of M'' #5, (June 2006) the traveling mutant [[Quicksilver (comics)|Quicksilver]] convinces him to try the mutagenic compound called the ''Terrigen Mists'', which had been stolen from the [[Inhumans]]. Freakshow regains his powers, but like the other mutants who had used the mist, it comes with a price. For some time, he is unable to change out of his large, monstrous form. While trapped like this, he and the other Genosha mutants are drawn into battle with the [[Inhumans]], who are tracking down Quicksilver. Some time after, the effects of the mist wear off.{{issue|date=January 2011}} ==Powers and abilities== Freakshow is a megamorph with the ability to transform his body into a variety of monstrous forms with unique abilities (such as a [[dragon]] form capable of flight and fire breathing). While in these forms he has enhanced strength, speed, stamina, and resistance to injury, along with the special characteristics of each form. He has also been shown to take on [[humanoid]] forms, specifically an armored form akin to [[Colossus (comics)|Colossus]] and a [[mythology|mythological]] [[Norse mythology|Nordic]][[Troll]]. In all of these forms, Freakshow is still capable of human speech. ==Another Freakshow== In ''X-Force'' #101, a young mutant known as Kevin, nicknamed ''Freakshow'', nearly fell to his death when attempting to impress others his age by proving that he could fly.
